metadata.title: CVE-2020-14364 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: An out-of-bounds read/write access flaw was found in the USB emulator ofthe QEMU in versions before 5.2.0. This issue occurs while processing USBpackets from a guest when USBDevice 'setup_len' exceeds its'data_buf[4096]' in the do_token_in, do_token_out routines. This flawallows a guest user to crash the QEMU process, resulting in a denial ofservice, or the potential execution of arbitrary code with the privilegesof the QEMU process on the host.

criterions.comment: qemu: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
